intro: Geanthus humilis, commonly known as the lowland geanthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms in the spring. Geanthus humilis is often found in USDA hardiness zones 5 through 8, making it a suitable addition to native plant gardens.
